de.must.dataobj
Class SqlDialect

java.lang.Object
  de.must.dataobj.SqlDialect
Direct Known Subclasses:
Db2400Dialect, DbaseDialect, MSAccessDialect, MSSQLServerDialect, MysqlDialect, OracleDialect, SQLiteDialect
public abstract class SqlDialect
extends java.lang.Object

Super class for all database specific operations. Each database defines its own subclass to handle their typical sql dialects. The specific dialect is loaded when DataObject is created.

See Also:
ConnectionHolder, DataObject

transformStringWhenSaving

public java.lang.String transformStringWhenSaving(java.lang.String columnName,
                                                  java.lang.String value)
Converts String values before sending to database. Needed if databases comes in trouble with control bytes like e.g. "\n", Override it if necessary.

Parameters:
value - the value to transform
Returns:
the transformed value

getLimitationFragment

protected java.lang.String getLimitationFragment(int limit,
                                                 int offset)
Returns the limitation fragment of the SQL statement.

Parameters:
limit - maximum of entries to be put into the result set
offset - the number of records that don't have to be read anymore
Returns:
the limitation fragment

setAttributes

protected void setAttributes(AbstractAttribute[] attributes)
Sets the list of attributes. Helpful to determine things that may not be determined by meta data like column type.

Parameters:
the - attributes of the data object.

isKnownAsBoolean

protected boolean isKnownAsBoolean(java.lang.String columnName)
Checks whether or not the specified column is of type boolean by evaluating the attributes of the data object if available.

Parameters:
columnName - the name of the column to be checked as boolean type
Returns:
true if the specified column is of type boolean
